page.title: 14INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: {SIX CHILDREN WENT TO INTERVIEW AN {ELDERLY COUPLE WHO HAVE LIVED IN THE {AREA FOR 80 YEARS: The couple interviewed had witnessed phenomenal changes in the area during their lifetime.They believe one of the major changes has been transport-they remember trams and trolley buses where there are now busy main roads with three lanes of heavy traffic School was different:they had the cane if they were late and there were no school dinners;they left school at the age of thirteen. Shops were mainly corner shops but "Lipton's" was popular for buying food-just like today. There was no T.V. so they amused themselves by playing games and listening to the radio. The couple prefer life today because the standard of life is higher.
